page.title: 14SERVICES WELBURY & DEIGHTON
page.content: Apart from the pub,shop and Post Office in Welbury there are few local amenities.The doctor's surgery is held in Appleton Wiske Hall every Tuesday morning, the library van calls once a fortnight and a fish & chip van calls one evening per week. Local farmers make use of the grain merchants/feed mill at Deighton, but most of the farming business is conducted at marts in Northallerton & Darlington.Many housewives shop at Northallerton or travel to Teesside or Darlington.There is no gas supply to the villages .Most houses have central heating systems, run either from oil,electricity or solid fuel.Many houses have an open coal fire in the living room. There is a daily doorstep delivery of milk. The dustbins are emptied each week by the local council.
